Note: Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for a Liberty Loan campaign. The text tells about the Steamship Lusitania, an unarmed passenger craft, which was sunk by the Germans.  To support the boys "on their way to Berlin to demand an accounting," Americans must buy bonds with every dollar they have.  The illustration shows a woman and her children lying under the water.  Roses appear at top of picture and part of ship is seen.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
